event.name: For Greater Consciousness
event.description: For Greater Consciousness is an epic piano rock mini-orchestra at CMU.
event.summary: For Greater Consciousness is an epic piano rock mini-orchestra at CMU.

event.name: Late Night - Film Festival
event.description:
An Engineers Without Borders Late Night event:
Come to the UC at 9pm for a touching film festival.
We will be showing: 1. From Rutgers University, the film "Thailand Untapped" It's extremely well made and the audience feedback has been very positive. 2. From the Hartford Professional Chapter, we have "Welcome to Abheypur". 3. The last film is from Princeton University. It takes place in Ghana and follows the construction of a school library.
event.summary: Films delve into service projects in Thailand, Abheypur, and Ghana

event.name: Madrigal Dinner
event.description:
Music, Magic, Mime, Mirth, and More! Celebrate the end of the semester and welcome the holiday season with a unique dining and entertainment experience!
Featuring: CMU School of Music Chamber Singers Directed by Michael Van Camp
Master of Ceremonies Lord of Misrule, Sir Jester, Will Weiner
Tickets $10 CMU Students (or use a meal Block) $20 All other Guests $10 Children under 12 years Tickets sold at the UC Information Desk
Hosted by Anne Witchner. Sponsored by Office of Orientation, Student Affairs, Alumni relations, Student Senate, Carnegie Mellon School of Music, SDC, Culinart
event.summary: Music, Magic, Mime, Mirth, and More! Celebrate the end of the semester and welcome the holiday season with a unique dining and entertainment experience!

event.name: College Radio Day
event.description: The aim of College Radio Day is to raise a greater, international awareness of the many college and high school radio stations that operate around the world by encouraging people who would not normally listen to college radio to do so on this day. It is hoped that those people who do tune in like what they hear and become regular listeners. The organizers of College Radio Day believe that college radio is one of the last remaining bastions of creative radio programming, free from the constrictions of having to be commercially viable, and a place where those involved in its programming believe passionately in its mission. College radio is the only free live medium brave enough to play unsigned, local, and independent artists on a regular basis. Indeed, many famous and successful bands today, owe their initial break to being played on colllege radio. Put simply, college radio is an important part of the media landscape because of its unique and fearless programming.
event.summary: College radio is the only free live medium brave enough to play unsigned, local, and independent artists on a regular basis. Indeed, many famous and successful bands today, owe their initial break to being played on colllege radio.

event.name: After Effects: A Crash Course Workshop
event.description: You'92ll learn the basics of After Effects! Tools such as masking, movement, and color effects. We want you to walk away from the workshop feeling confident to try out After Effects editing and animation on your own. We will show examples of both personal works and projects we think are really cool. No prior experience is required!
event.summary: You'92ll learn the basics of After Effects! We will show examples of both personal works and projects we think are really cool. No prior experience is required!

event.name: Los Valientes: Celebrating Hispanic Heritage
event.description:
Los Valientes (The Courageous Ones) is a live music theater work based on the lives of three heroic Latinos, the show celebrates Mexian painter Diego Rivera, martyred Salvadoran Archbishop Oscar Romero and Mexican-American outlaw Joaquin Murrieta (some say the Zorro character was based on this historical figure).
Dessert Reception to follow in CFA Lobby
FREE TICKETED EVENT
Tickets available at University Center Info Desk
Sponsored by Modern Languages, Student Affairs and the Vice Provost for Education
event.summary: Los Valientes (The Courageous Ones) is a live music theater work based on the lives of three heroic Latinos, the show celebrates Mexian painter Diego Rivera, martyred Salvadoran Archbishop Oscar Romero and Mexican-American outlaw Joaquin Murrieta.

event.name: Constructing Clay Vessels
event.description: This workshop will cover the basics of making forms out of clay. Techniques will include slab building, coil building, and building around forms. After demonstrating the different techniques, students will be able to build anything they want. Any idea is worth trying, and imaginative projects are encouraged. Vessels don'92t have to be boring! Make sure to wear something you'92re not afraid to get dirty.
event.summary: This workshop will cover the basics of making forms out of clay. Techniques will include slab building, coil building, and building around forms.

event.name: Sleigh Bells
event.description:
AB Concerts is bringing Sleigh Bells to Carnegie Mellon for Fall Concert!
Who: Sleigh Bells What: Fall Concert 2012 Where: Wiegand Gym in the University Center When: November 10, 2012 || Doors at 8PM
Tickets are free for CMU students with ID. 10 dollars for everyone else! Pick up your tickets at the UC Information Desk starting - TBA.
event.summary: AB Concerts is bringing Sleigh Bells to Carnegie Mellon for Fall Concert!

event.name: TOC
event.description: Technical Opportunities Conference - A networking event!
event.summary: TOC

event.name: John Kolb Presents: What Does It Mean to Be a Man?
event.description: John Kolb is a former Pittsburgh Steeler from 1969-1981. He has won 4 Super Bowl Championships and was widely regarded as the NFL's strongest player. His message on what it means to be a man centers around his personal journey of understanding his own masculinity. He focuses on family, spirituality, and fighting hyper-masculinity. He is a powerful speaker with a very inclusive message. Please come to join us to hear him speak. Free pizza!
event.summary: John Kolb is a former Pittsburgh Steeler from 1969-1981. He has won 4 Super Bowl Championships and was widely regarded as the NFL's strongest player. Please come to join us to hear him speak. Free pizza!

event.name: Moonrise Kingdom
event.description: AB Films is showing Moonrise Kingdom on Thursday, October 11, at 8pm, 10pm, and Midnight. Runtime: 94 minutes (1hr 34min) | Price: $1 with CMU ID (must show ID); $3 otherwise This comedy/drama is loaded with stars - Bruce Willis, Bill Murray, Frances McDormand, Edward Norton. Set on a little island off the New England coast in the 1960s, this film tells the tale of a young couple that ran away in love and the town that searches after them.
event.summary: Come watch Moonrise Kingdom!

event.name: Demosplash
event.description: Demosplash is a computer art festival in the spirit of the demoscene, going into greater depth on the artistic and technical skills of the demoscene through a series of short talks, tutorial/hacking events, and several competitions. In addition to demos, of course. Check out www.demosplash.org for a list of events and more information.
event.summary: Computer art festival!

event.name: Code 2600
event.description:
AB Films is showing Code 2600 on Friday, October 12, at 7pm*, and 10pm.
Runtime: 82 minutes (1hr 22min) | Price: All showings of this film are FREE!
This is the Pittsburgh Premier of Code 2600. There will be a special Q&A with the director after the 7pm showing!
This documentary explores the age of information technology, and the benefits it has for connecting the world, while putting personal security on the edge.
event.summary: This documentary explores the age of information technology, and the benefits it has for connecting the world, while putting personal security on the edge.

event.name: Indie Game: The Movie
event.description:
AB Films is showing Indie Game: The Movie on Saturday, October 13, at 10pm and Midnight.
Runtime: 94 minutes (1hr 34min) | Price: $1 with CMU ID (must show ID); $3 otherwise
Watch this documentary that follows the unique story of indie games and the people who make them.

event.description:
AB Films is showing Rango on Sunday, September 16, at 6pm, 8pm, and 10pm.

Johnny Depp is the voice of Rango - a regular chameleon who winds up in a lawless town in the heart of the Wild West - in this animated adventure/comedy.

event.name: The Dark Knight
event.description:
As part of BATMAN WEEKEND, AB Films is showing The Dark Knight on Friday, November 16
Showtimes:
7:00 pm 10:00 pm 1:00 am Runtime: 152 minutes (2hr 32min)
Price: $1 with CMU ID (must show ID); $3 otherwise
Director/Writer Christopher Nolan is back with the second installment in his trilogy of Batman films. We all know the story of Bruce Wayne (Christian Bale) who loses his parents as a child and later becomes the Batman - protecting his city from crime. This time around we get a closer look at one of Batman's most infamous foes, the Joker (Heath Ledger).
event.summary: We all know the story of Bruce Wayne (Christian Bale) who loses his parents as a child and later becomes the Batman - protecting his city from crime. This time around we get a closer look at one of Batman's most infamous foes, the Joker (Heath Ledger).

event.name: Tartans Abroad Group Showcase
event.description: Come hear summer Tartans Abroad Group scholarship recipients, SIFE Nicaragua and Project Rwanda, discuss and present their work abroad. Learn how you can also be involved in Short-Term service experiences abroad. Light refreshments will be served.
event.summary: Come hear summer Tartans Abroad Group scholarship recipients, SIFE Nicaragua and Project Rwanda, discuss and present their work abroad. Learn how you can also be involved in Short-Term service experiences abroad. Light refreshments will be served.

event.description: Come to learn about CMU's International Justice Mission, what we're doing to end human trafficking, and about leadership positions!
event.summary: Come to learn about CMU's International Justice Mission, what we're doing to end human trafficking, and about leadership positions!

event.name: The Dark Knight Rises
event.description:
As part of BATMAN WEEKEND, AB Films is showing The Dark Knight Rises on Saturday, November 17
Showtimes:
7:00 pm 10:00 pm 1:00 am Runtime: 165 minutes (2hr 45min)
Price: $1 with CMU ID (must show ID); $3 otherwise
This film features the city of Pittsburgh, and part was shot on CMU's campus!
Director/Writer Christopher Nolan returns for the final installment in his trilogy of Batman films. We all know the story of Bruce Wayne (Christian Bale) who loses his parents as a child and later becomes the Batman - protecting his city from crime. But eight years have passed since we last saw him, and much has changed. When a new villain, Bane (Tom Hardy), surfaces, the Batman emerges once again, despite facing a city that has turned against him.
event.summary: As part of BATMAN WEEKEND, AB Films is showing The Dark Knight Rises on Saturday, November 17

event.name: Kiltie Band
event.description: Started in 1908 by a group of just seven students dedicated to supporting Carnegie Tech football, today's Kiltie Band continues a tradition of excellence originated nearly a century ago... At least that's what our recruiting brochure says. We wear kilts, act crazy, and have lots of fun with instruments.

event.name: 18th Annual Mobot Races, 15th Awards Presentation
event.description: The School of Computer Science invites all members of the Carnegie Mellon community to participate in The 18th Annual Carnegie Mellon Mobot Races. Participants will race autonomous vehicles ("MObile roBOTs") they have built along a slalon-type course on the paved walk in front of Wean Hall. Races are followed by an Awards Presentation and Wrap-Up event in Gates and Hillman Rashid Auditorium.
event.location: Mobot Course in front of Wean Hall, Gates 4401
event.summary: Participants will race autonomous vehicles ("MObile roBOTs") they have built along a slalon-type course on the paved walk in front of Wean Hall. Races are followed by an Awards Presentation and Wrap-Up event in Gates and Hillman Rashid Auditorium.

event.name: Robotics Project Demos
event.description:
The Robotics Institute will celebrate the third annual National Robotics Week on April 20 with project demonstrations, lab tours, the annual Mobot (mobile robot) races, a special lecture by Professor Howie Choset and a Robot reception. Demos will include River Exploration Vehicles, Snake Robots, Calliope, and Canine.
Pre-registration is required. Please register at the following link: https://www.surveymonkey.com/s/ 2012NRWRSVP
event.location: Planetary Robotics Lab Highbay - Gates and Hillman 1st Floor
event.summary: The Robotics Institute will celebrate the third annual National Robotics Week on April 20 with project demonstrations, lab tours, the annual Mobot (mobile robot) races, a special lecture by Professor Howie Choset and a Robot reception.

event.description: Our club is both a social organization, with beginner lessons and social dance events, and a dance school, teaching novices and veterans a large variety of Ballroom and Latin dances. We welcome all CMU students and members of the Pittsburgh community. Anyone can learn to dance - including you!
event.summary: Our club is both a social organization, with beginner lessons and social dance events, and a dance school, teaching novices and veterans a large variety of Ballroom and Latin dances.

event.name: Slingshot Genius
event.description: Slingshot Genius is an original five-piece rock band from Pittsburgh, PA. Songwriter Scott Canavan had the initial concepts for some of the songs when the band met in 2008 after finding each other on Craigslist, all of them searching for local musicians who shared a passion for composing original material. Since then, the band has been playing regularly in local clubs and opening for touring national acts such as Breaking Laces and Red Wanting Blue.
event.summary: Live Music

event.name: Tim Ruff Trio
event.description: Embarking on his professional music journey in the summer of 2010, singer-songwriter Tim Ruff eagerly bolted out of the gates with high hopes and a keen suspicion as to how his '93acoustic crooner'94 style would go over in the real world. He is an alumni of the Carnegie Mellon University School of Music.

event.description: The CMU Filmmaking Club proudly presents our annual Spring Carnival festival which showcases and premieres student film works of the past year. This year's festival theme, "The Loop", celebrates a return to the basics of filmmaking and encourages innovation and creative storytelling. Music Composed by Sean Pack Choreography JR Wong
event.summary: This year's festival theme, "The Loop", celebrates a return to the basics of filmmaking and encourages innovation and creative storytelling.

event.name: TGICarnival Dance Party!
event.description: Straight outta LA, BetaTraxx brings a whole new level of dance music. Tim Nelson, aka BetaTraxx, is signed to Dirty Dutch Records, runs the blog "Our Electric Generation", and has released a whole slew of EP's and remixes. In his own words: "I make Techno Music. Often for dancing, but sometimes not." Opening the show is Club Static's resident spinmaster, DJ Strobe. You won't want to miss this extreme dance party. Event by ab Coffeehouse, ab Special Events, and SDC. Doors open at 8:00 pm.
event.summary: Dance party presented by AB Coffeehouse, AB Special Events, and Student Dormitory Council.

event.name: Scotch'n'Soda Theatre presents: The Cambridge Footlights
event.description:
Come see our friends from across the pond!
The Cambridge Footlights are a sketch comedy troupe from Cambridge University. Their list of alumni is impressive, including Sacha Baron Cohen, Eric Idle, Hugh Laurie, Emma Thompson and more! They'll only be here for one night, so make sure you see them before they move on to their next stop on their international tour!
Two Shows: 8:00 PM and 10:00 PM
Tickets are $5 w/ student id, and $10 without. Reserve tickets now at snstheatre.org
event.summary: The Cambridge Footlights are a sketch comedy troupe from Cambridge University. Their list of alumni is impressive, including Sacha Baron Cohen, Eric Idle, Hugh Laurie, Emma Thompson and more!

event.name: Scotch'n'Soda Theatre's 5th Annual Charity Cabaret Auditions
event.description:
Come audition for Scotch'n'Soda's 5th Annual Charity Cabaret benefitting the Alumni Theater Company which helps provide opportunities for Pittsburgh youth to participate in theater. Find out more at http://www.alumnitheatercompany.org/
Sign up for an audition slot at scotch.snstheatre.org
Auditions will take place from Saturday, September 22 to Sunday, September 23. Time slots will vary.
The performance will be Friday, October 5th at 8:30pm (Ceilidh Weekend).
Please read the description below for exact details about how to prepare for your audition:
Auditioners need to come prepared with one musical theatre song that they will sing. This song should be performance ready. They should bring an extra copy of the sheet music for their song that the director will keep to give to their accompanist, should they be cast. Auditioners can audition with a maximum of one individual song and then can (but are not required to) audition with others for one additional duet or small group number. If this is the case please select one audition slot for the individual song and then one person in the group should select an additional audition slot for the group number. If you have any questions or are interested in accompanying, please email Will Weiner at wweiner@andrew.cmu.edu
event.summary: Come audition for Scotch'n'Soda's 5th Annual Charity Cabaret benefitting the Alumni Theater Company which helps provide opportunities for Pittsburgh youth to participate in theater. Find out more at http://www.alumnitheatercompany.org/

event.name: SCHLAGFEST 2012
event.description:
Hamerschlag's Major Fall Event!
SchlagFest 2012- a carnival styled atmosphere constructed entirely by the men of Hamerschalg house. It is hamerschlags coming out party to the entire campus. The entire community will be in awe of the wonderful attraction that will be constructed by the men of Hamerschlag House.
event.summary: Hamerschlag's Major Fall Event!

event.name: General Body Meeting
event.description:
Engineers Without Borders is having an interest meeting... this Wednesday!
Project Symbiosist Our chapter's capstone project, we're working in Rampur to bring sustainable energy to a school in the community. We are working on getting this project off the ground and going strong, so sign up to help out. Check out the India project page to learn more about the village and project.
Water Supply & Purification in Ecuadort In partnership with the EWB Pittsburgh Professional Chapter, we are working to design and implement a sustainable water supply system for the 150 residents of the Tingo Pucara community.
OUR MISSION EWB-USA supports community-driven development programs worldwide by collaborating with local partners to design and implement sustainable engineering projects, while creating transformative experiences and responsible leaders. The Carnegie Mellon Chapter of EWB-USA seeks to better our members, our university, and our world by implementing socially and environmentally sustainable engineering projects in partnership with developing communities around the globe.
OUR HISTORY The Carnegie Mellon Chapter of Engineers Without Borders-USA was established in 2008, and has been growing strong ever since. One of the fastest growing engineering clubs on campus, we started as just a handful of students interested in similar things but now boast a chapter size of 70 active members. And we don't plan on slowing down.
event.summary: Engineers Without Borders is having an interest meeting... this Wednesday!

event.description:

Runtime: 96 minutes (1hr 36min) | Price: $1 with CMU ID (must show ID); $3 otherwise

event.name: Beasts of the Southern Wild
event.description:
AB Films is showing Beasts of the Southern Wild on Friday, February 1
Showtimes:
8:00 pm 10:00 pm Midnight Runtime: 93 minutes (1hr 33min)
Price: $1 with CMU ID (must show ID); $3 otherwise
Nominated for 4 Oscars (2013) including Best Picture and Best Actress (Quvenzhan'e9 Wallis), and winner of the 2012 Sundance Grand Jury Prize, this film explores the journey of one six-year-old girl searching for her mother and her place in the universe - amidst a flooded town and dangerous beasts.
event.summary: Nominated for 4 Oscars (2013) including Best Picture and Best Actress (Quvenzhan'e9 Wallis), and winner of the 2012 Sundance Grand Jury Prize, this film explores the journey of one six-year-old girl searching for her mother and her place in the universe - amidst a flooded town and dangerous beasts.

Tickets are $8 pre-sale and $10 at the door. Look for ASA/TSA/Mayur-SASA members selling tickets inside the UC all week!
Don't miss out!

event.name: Dance Marathon 2013
event.description: CMU Dance Marathon's mission is to provide an entertaining and competitive atmosphere for students while raising awareness of the everyday struggles that families with disabled children experience. Students who participate in this event will do so in honor of those who can'92t dance, and who most likely will never be able to. Best of all, 100% of the money we raise will go to Variety Pittsburgh for the children in these families and make their lives better! Our third annual Dance Marathon will be held on Saturday February 2nd, 2013 in Weigand Gymnasium.
event.summary: CMU Dance Marathon's mission is to provide an entertaining and competitive atmosphere for students while raising awareness of the everyday struggles that families with disabled children experience.

event.name: Anna Karenina
event.description:
AB Films is showing Anna Karenina on Sunday, February 3
Showtimes:
7:30 pm 10:00 pm 12:30 am Runtime: 129 minutes (2hr 09min)
Price: $1 with CMU ID (must show ID); $3 otherwise
In high-society Russia in the late 19th-century, Anna Karenina - an aristocratic woman who married too young - enters into an affair that shocked the nation. From the director of Pride and Predjudice, comes another tale about love - Keira Knightley, Jude Law, and Aaron Taylor-Johnson star in this 4-time Oscar nominated film (for 2013, including Best Costume Design, and Best Cinematography).
event.summary: In high-society Russia in the late 19th-century, Anna Karenina - an aristocratic woman who married too young - enters into an affair that shocked the nation.

event.name: Fall Activities Fair
event.description:
Carnegie Mellon University is home to 280+ student-run organizations recognized by Student Government. The Office of Student Activities organizes a Fall Activities Fair that will showcase many of our student organizations. Groups span a wide variety of interests and passions representing religious/spiritual, community service/philanthropy, student government, media/publications, club sports/martial arts, professional/academic, political, performance/artistic, gaming, technology, and general interest opportunities.
Recognized Student Organizations will be able to register for the Activities Fair starting Monday, August 19, 2013 through a form on The Bridge. Information will be sent out to all student organization Presidents and Primary Contacts (please make sure you update this information). Register: https://thebridge.cmu.edu/form/start/25350 (copy and paste link)
event.location: CFA Lawn (Rain Location: Wiegand Gym, UC)
event.summary: Carnegie Mellon University is home to 280+ student-run organizations recognized by Student Government. The Office of Student Activities organizes a Fall Activities Fair that will showcase many of our student organizations.

event.name: Bat Boy the Musical Auditions
event.description:
Auditions will take place September 4th, 5th, and 6th.
If you'd like to audition, please prepare 16 bars of a musical theatre song and be prepared to read a few scenes from the show.
Callbacks will be Sunday, September 8th.
Sign up for auditions at snstheatre.org. Clicking attend on this event will not automatically give you an audition time.
If you have questions about auditions, email the co-directors, Corrine Rockoff, at crockoff@andrew.cmu.edu and Billy Veer at wav@andrew.cmu.edu. The musical directors, Alex Petti (apetti@andrew.cmu.edu) and Emma Harger (eharger@andrew.cmu.edu) will also be available for contact.
If performing isn't for you, you are welcome to attend our tech interest meeting. All details can be found at https://www.facebook.com/events/191834810995342/?notif_t=plan_user_joined
event.summary: If you have questions about auditions, email the co-directors, Corrine Rockoff, at crockoff@andrew.cmu.edu and Billy Veer at wav@andrew.cmu.edu. The musical directors, Alex Petti (apetti@andrew.cmu.edu) and Emma Harger (eharger@andrew.cmu.edu) will also be available for contact.

event.name: Demosplash
event.description: Demosplash is the largest demoparty in North America, catering both to newcomers to the demoscene as well as established artists. We show demos live on original hardware as much as possible, offering a viewing experience that can't be matched by emulators or recordings. In addition to screenings, this year will feature a variety of events, including talks, workshops, and open retro gaming sessions.
event.summary: Demosplash is the largest demoparty in North America. We show demos live on original hardware as much as possible, offering an experience that can't be matched by emulators or recordings.

event.name: Stand Up Paddleboarding
event.description:
Pittsburgh Connections goes Stand Up Paddleboarding, the fastest growing water sport in the world! Join us on this lazy afternoon to try something new and exciting. No experience is necessary and all equipment is provided.
Don't know what Stand Up Paddleboarding is? That's ok! Come give it a try anyway. We promise you'll have a good time.
Ticket Cost: $10 (one per CMU ID) Tickets go on sale Sept 2 @ 8am.
Bus Departs: 1:15pm from the UC Turnaround
Bus Returns: approx 4:30pm
The Pittsburgh Connections program is coordinated through the Office of Student Activities and is generously funded by the RK Mellon Foundation, the Dozzi family, and the Division of Student Affairs. The program strives to engage students in outdoor recreation, environmental stewardship, and cultural awareness throughout Pittsburgh and Western Pennsylvania. The core goals of these activities are to help students develop and maintain a physically active lifestyle, build leadership skills, and increase their appreciation for the Western Pennsylvania region.
event.summary: Pittsburgh Connections goes Stand Up Paddleboarding, the fastest growing water sport in the world! Join us on this lazy afternoon to try something new and exciting. No experience is necessary and all equipment is provided.

event.name: Chinese New Year Dinner
event.description:
Come celebrate the beginning of the Year of the Snake with Awareness of Roots in Chinese Culture (ARCC) by enjoying traditional Chinese dishes! Here's the menu: ~APPETIZERS~ Dumplings Tea eggs
~SOUP~ Beef meatball soup with wintermelon
~ENTREES~ Double cooked pork Braised mince pork Chicken legs Bok choy Stir fried noodles with veggies Pumpkin and pork
~DESSERTS~ Creamy custard bun Nian gao (year cake)
Tickets are $10 pre-sale and $12 at the door if there are any left over. We'll be tabling the week before Chinese New Year Dinner (week of 2/4) and selling tickets along with dumplings.
event.summary: Come celebrate the beginning of the Year of the Snake with Awareness of Roots in Chinese Culture (ARCC) by enjoying traditional Chinese dishes!

event.name: The Incredibles
event.description:
AB Films is showing The Incredibles on Saturday, February 9
Showtimes:
8:00 pm 10:00 pm Midnight Runtime: 115 minutes (1hr 55min)
Price: $1 with CMU ID (must show ID); $3 otherwise
Winner of the Best Animated Film at the Oscars in 2005, Disney/Pixar's "The Incredibles" is the hilarious and action-filled tale about a super family trying to blend in, and the dad who can't let go of his heroic past.
event.summary: Winner of the Best Animated Film at the Oscars in 2005, Disney/Pixar's "The Incredibles" is the hilarious and action-filled tale about a super family trying to blend in, and the dad who can't let go of his heroic past.

event.name: CMU Bhangra Tryouts
event.description:
Come audition for CMU Bhangra! Sign up at bit.ly/cmubhangra
The tryouts involve a learning session to learn the tryout choregraphy, and an audition slot during which you will perform that choreography. Please sign up for one of each (on the form linked above).
event.summary: Come audition for CMU Bhangra! Sign up at bit.ly/cmubhangra
